intro: Sycocarpus, commonly known as the honeycomb plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences that resemble honeycombs, giving it its common name. The plants typically have palmately compound leaves and produce small, white or yellowish flowers. Sycocarpus species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
